business.headline: Employees unpaid, control slipping: Bira 91's bad hangoverThe taps are dry, employees unpaid, and investors have taken charge. The question isn't how Bira 91 got here anymore. It's whether it can get out.

Gold loan vs gold overdraft: Which one truly saves you money?Gold loans and gold overdrafts both help unlock the value of your jewellery when you need cash fast. But they don't work the same way — and one could quietly cost you more than you think.

Meta plans record $30 billion bond sale to stay ahead in AI rcaseThe move comes as Meta signals that its capital expenditure in 2026 will be "notably larger" than next year, underscoring how aggressively it is investing to stay ahead in the AI race.

Lenskart IPO opens: Check GMP, price band, and should you apply?The total issue size is about Rs 7,278 crore, of which roughly Rs 2,150 crore is a fresh issue, while the rest is an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

Gold prices shaky, silver steady. What next for precious metals?Gold is wobbling as the dollar strengthens, while silver holds firm on industrial demand cues. With central banks still buying and the Fed unpredictable, where do precious metals go next?

Sensex, Nifty open flat in volatile trade; NTPC, Cipla among top losersAt around 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up just 21.15 points at 84,425.61, while the NSE Nifty50 edged higher by 7.35 points to 25,885.20. Broader market indices also hovered marginally higher, mirroring the lack of conviction at the headline level.

Gold and silver prices remain stable: Will prices gain after US Fed rate cut?Gold and silver prices steadied on Thursday after a choppy start, as investors weighed the impact of the US Federal Reserve's latest rate cut and awaited further clarity on global economic cues.

Cipla CEO Umang Vohra to exit in 2026; COO Achin Gupta named successorThe company said Achin Gupta, currently Cipla's Global Chief Operating Officer (COO), will take over as CEO and MD from April 1, 2026.

Novo Nordisk starts bidding war with Pfizer over US biotech MetseraNovo Nordisk bid up to $8.5 billion, including $6 billion upfront and later milestone payments. Pfizer's bid was worth $7.3 billion including milestones.
Sensex closes 593 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 592.67 points to close at 84,404.46, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 176.05 points to end at 25,877.85.

The sons in Tata Sons: A legacy forged in destiny by adoptionFor two centuries, the Tata name has symbolised Indian industry and philanthropy. But who exactly are Tata Sons? Who are the heirs to the empire founded by Jamsetji Tata? This is where the saga began.

Elon Musk's Starlink kicks off demo runs in Mumbai ahead of India launchDuring the trial, Starlink is expected to demonstrate how its technology can deliver fast and reliable internet, even in remote areas where traditional broadband services are often unavailable.

Groww IPO details out. Check price band, GMP, and important datesGroww IPO consists of a fresh issue of 10.60 crore shares worth Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 55.72 crore shares amounting to Rs 5,572.30 crore.

Lenskart solutions IPO opens on October 31: Should you subscribe or wait?The much-awaited initial public offering (IPO) of Lenskart Solutions will open for subscription on October 31. As India's leading eyewear brand hits the primary market, investors are weighing if now is the right time to take a position.

End of big workforces? What Amazon's mass layoff really signalsAmazon's mass layoffs aren't about cutting costs; they signal a shift in how work is organised. AI is taking over tasks, but the real battle is about how companies value people.

Why India's IPO boom isn't always a sign of growth. Explains expertIndia's IPO market may be buzzing with record fundraising and investor enthusiasm, yet experts say much of the money raised isn't going into new projects or job creation.

UPS to cut 48,000 jobs this year amid major turnaround pushShares of the Atlanta-based delivery giant rose more than 7% in afternoon trading on Tuesday after it reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue.

ITR deadline for audit cases extended till December 10. Who benefits and what nextTaxpayers requiring audit reports have got more time this year — the CBDT has extended the ITR filing due date to December 10, 2025.

entertainment.headline: Aileen Queen of Serial Killers review: Beyond the chilling murders, a broken systemRelease Date:Thu Oct 30, 2025 The documentary 'Aileen: Queen of the Serial Killers' delivers a gripping look at Aileen Wuornos's tragic life and the media circus that defined her. It probes the uneasy intersection of abuse, justice, and sensationalism, challenging how society portrays women who kill.

Baaghi 4 OTT release: When and where to watch Tiger Shroff's action thriller After a strong theatrical run, Tiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4' is now streaming on Prime Video in India and over 240 countries, bringing back the franchise's trademark action and intensity for global audiences.

Dining With The Kapoors: Ranbir, Kareena's family documentary releases November 21 The new poster of the upcoming documentary - 'Dining With The Kapoors', based on Bollywood's first family was recently unveiled. The film explores the Kapoor family's legacy, food traditions, and cinematic journey, premiering on November 21, 2025.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan gushes over sabudana vada, calls it so tasty 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17 continues to engage viewers as host Amitabh Bachchan and contestant Parima Jaiswal share personal stories and challenges, while the show highlights contestant journeys, lifelines, and memorable moments from the latest episode.

Yami Gautam addresses Haq censorship rumours, shares who can watch the film Yami Gautam, lead actor in courtroom drama 'Haq', states that the film based on the Shah Bano Begum case has not encountered censorship issues in the UAE and will be accessible to viewers aged 15 and above.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 10: Film stays strong with Rs 55 crore haul 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', starring Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa, has collected Rs 55 crore in India, outperforming 'Metro In Dino' despite mixed reviews and stiff box office competition.

Single Salma review: Huma's film is empowering on paper, exhausting on screenRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 'Single Salma' explores a woman's journey to self-discovery amid societal and family pressures. The film's important message is weakened by slow pacing and inconsistent storytelling.

Kim Kardashian questions moon landing, NASA claps back with facts Reality star Kim Kardashian has sparked debate after sharing her doubts about the 1969 Moon landing, citing TikTok evidence and challenging established history. NASA officials have responded, reiterating the authenticity of the lunar missions and addressing the viral discussion.

IT Welcome To Derry review: Horror gets personal in dark, smart prequel seriesRelease Date:Sun Oct 26, 2025 'IT: Welcome To Derry' moves beyond the iconic Losers' Club to spotlight the town itself, crafting a chilling tale set amid the societal unrest of the 1960s. Premiered on October 26, the series unpacks themes of racism and paranoia with eerie precision.

Are Dove and Damiano taking the next step? Here's why fans think so Reports indicate Dove Cameron and Damiano David are engaged following two years of dating, marked by public anniversary tributes and recent sightings together.

Thamma box office Day 10: Ayushmann-Rashmika film earns Rs 108 crore in India 'Thamma', starring Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna, has crossed Rs 108 crore at the Indian box office, strengthening Maddock's horror-comedy universe ahead of 'Bhediya 2' and 'Shakti Shalini'.

Baahubali The Epic mints Rs 10 crore, records biggest opening for re-release 'Baahubali: The Epic' set a new benchmark for Indian film re-releases by recording over Rs 10 crore in worldwide pre-sales on its opening day, marking the biggest re-release opening while previous overall records remain with 'Sanam Teri Kasam'.

Scream 7 trailer: Sidney Prescott returns to face chilling new Ghostface threat The trailer for Scream 7 reveals Sidney Prescott and Gale Weathers returning to confront a new Ghostface, with the killer's focus shifting to Sidney's daughter. The film, directed by Kevin Williamson, draws on the legacy of the nearly 30-year-old franchise and teases direct links to earlier entries.

Roi Roi Binale: Zubeen Garg's last film opens to sea of blind loveZubeen Garg's Roi Roi Binale is about love and a promise kept. Assam and the Assamese community are showing the world how to return love. As thousands watch the movie, which released on Friday, with welled-up eyes, it will be a final embrace, and a promise to an icon who shaped Assamese identity and revived Assam's film industry single-handedly. Roi Roi Binale could be cathartic for grieving millions who loved Zubeen blindly.

I won't be there: Alyssa Healy drops retirement hint after World Cup semis lossAustralian captain Alyssa Healy cut an emotional figure as she hinted that Thursday's semi-final against India might have been her final appearance in the 50-over World Cup, moments after her team's shock defeat at the D.Y. Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues cries tears of joy in arms of parents after Australia heroicsJemimah Rodrigues broke down in tears of joy as she sank into her parents' arms after her unbeaten 127 powered India to a record 339-run chase against Australia in the Women's World Cup semi-final.

India's Miracle Chase! Women Maul Aussies In Record Run To Enter World Cup FinalThis special report covers the Indian women's cricket team's sensational victory over seven-time champions Australia to enter the World Cup final, focusing on key players Jemima Rodrigues and captain Harmanpreet Kaur. Rajdeep Sardesai called the performance, 'truly one of the great chases in world cricket'. In a stunning display, India achieved the highest-ever run chase in women's ODI history, successfully gunning down a mammoth target of 340. The victory was built on an unbeaten 127 by Jemima Rodrigues and a crucial 89 from Harmanpreet Kaur. The program features in-depth analysis from cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar and India Today's consulting editor Rajdeep Sardesai, breaking down the turning points of the match and what this win means for Indian cricket. India will now face South Africa in the final on Sunday.

Rohit, Gambhir join celebrations after India stun Australia in World Cup semisRohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir and Sachin Tendulkar joined in on the celebrations as India defeated Australia to reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025. India secured a record chase to set up the win in Navi Mumbai.

7-Months Pregnant, Delhi Cop Lifts 145kg To Win National BronzeThis special report features the inspiring story of Delhi Police Constable Sonika Yadav, who won a bronze medal at the All India Police Weightlifting event in Andhra Pradesh while seven months pregnant. Sonika, who lifted a combined weight of 145 kilograms, said, 'I don't want pregnancy to be taken as a setback or something that stops women from doing something. It is normal and I wanted to set an example'. Serving in the force since 2014, she carefully balanced her rigorous training with medical supervision, with the full support of her family and the Delhi Police. Her remarkable achievement has sparked conversations about the possibilities for pregnant women in professional sports and has made her a symbol of strength and resilience, proving that motherhood and ambition can go hand in hand.

Credit to Jemimah: Harman proud after Rodrigues special ends Australia's reignHarmanpreet Kaur lauded Jemimah Rodrigues after the Indian batter scored 127 runs and helped India beat Australia by five wickets on Thursday to book their berth in the final where they will face Australia.
